battleship

Class Ocean

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship.Ocean

  • public class Ocean
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates 10x10 array of Ships, representing "ocean," and associated methods
    Version:
    1.0 12/5/2016
    Author:
    Monica Rondon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ocean()
      Constructs "empty" ocean object and initializes game variables

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getHitCount()
      Returns the number of hits recorded (in this game).
      Ship[][] getShipArray()
      Returns actual 10x10 array of ships, not a copy.
      int getShotsFired()
      Returns number of shots fired in this game.
      boolean isGameOver()
      Returns true if all ships have been sunk, otherwise false.
      boolean isOccupied(int row, int column)
      Returns true if the given location contains a ship, false if not.
      void placeAllShipsRandomly()
      Places all ten ships randomly and legally on ocean.

      Places one ship randomly and legally on ocean

      Prints Ocean.
      boolean shootAt(int row, int column)
      Returns true if location shot has ship, false if not, updates shots/hits
      void tryToAddWake(int row, int column)
      Sets the isTaken parameter to true

        Returns true if the given location contains a ship, false if not.

        Returns:

      • shootAt

        public boolean shootAt(int row,
                       int column)
        Returns true if location shot has ship, false if not, updates shots/hits
        Parameters:

        column - of ship array
        Returns:

      • getShotsFired

        public int getShotsFired()
        Returns number of shots fired in this game.
        Returns:
        number of shots fired in game

      • getHitCount

        public int getHitCount()
        Returns the number of hits recorded (in this game). All hits are counted, not just the first time a given square is hit.
        Returns:
        number of hits in game

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns true if all ships have been sunk, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if game over, false if not.

      • getShipArray

        public Ship[][] getShipArray()
        Returns actual 10x10 array of ships, not a copy.
        Returns:
        ships array

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints Ocean. Numbers are 0 to 9. Uses '.' to indicate a location that you have never fired upon. Uses '-' to indicate a location that you have fired upon and hit nothing. Uses 'S' to indicate a location that you have fired upon and hit a ship. Uses 'x' to indication location containing a sunken ship.

      • tryToAddWake

        public void tryToAddWake(int row,
                         int column)
        Sets the isTaken parameter to true
        Parameters:
        row - being set to taken
        column - being set to taken
